unsw.cse.mica.runner
Class MicaRunner

java.lang.Object
  unsw.cse.mica.runner.MicaRunner

public class MicaRunner
extends java.lang.Object

MicaRunner is a utility for controlling Agent processes. It is provides the necessary functionality for controlling a blackboard and multiple agents in separate processes. Configuration is via an XML document that specifies the Agents that will be used, along with screen size and location coordinates for a Frame that will contain that agent's GUI (if used) At present, it has the following limitations: - The blackboard is always 'JavaBlackboard' - the transports are always the XMLNet classes Notes: - Parameters are passed to the agents via the "arg" XML elements. - the "-autostart" option causes all the child processes to begin immediately. - the "-nogui" causes the system to run without a GUI. -nogui implies -autostart. Note: When -nogui is used, there are two possible conditions under which the runner will terminate: 1. The runner terminates once all the Agent processes are complete. 2. It terminates if the the string "exit" or "quit" is read off its input stream.

Author:
jhw
